title: Drawing, "Figures in a Landscape", October 15, 1878
medium: Graphite, brush and watercolor on white watercolor paper
markings:
Watermark: "Damask Linene" and hand holding a rose.
Recto: Stamped in black ink, at lower right:  Museum for the Arts of Decoration, Cooper Union. Lugt, 457d.
signed: Signed and dated, with brush and watercolor, at lower left corner: HOMER OCT 15th 1878
inscribed:
Recto: Inscribed in graphite ?, at top: B[urnt]t. sienna; and again, at top right edge: Flesh color 
Verso: Inscribed in graphite ?: Leeds Oct 10th 1878.
creditline: Gift of Charles Savage Homer, Jr.
description:
Recto: A view of three groups of resting sheep partially filled in with color. Also on this sheet are a sketch of a standing sheep, partially colored and a ram’s head drawn lightly in graphite. 

Verso: Graphite sketches of two landscapes, the first with two figures, the second with two filled baskets.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Figures in a Landscape", October 15, 1878.
October 15, 1878. Graphite, brush and watercolor on white watercolor paper. Gift of Charles Savage Homer, Jr.. 1912-12-55.
